articles.author: Michail
articles.title: EU officials see no problem with Meta shutting down Facebook and Instagram - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
articles.description: Meta needs to process its user data on European servers if it wants to continue doing business in the EU.
articles.content: Meta submitted a report, which warned it may shut down its Facebook and Instagram services in Europe due to new regulations approved by the European Commission. The new EU laws force all companies to… [+1563 chars]

articles.title: Explainer: Why are Singapore's fuel pump prices at record highs and what does it mean for the economy? - TODAY
articles.description: SINGAPORE — Fuel prices at the pump have risen to their highest level on record in recent weeks, in the midst of an unabated hike in global crude oil prices due to a supply crunch and geopolitical turmoil in Europe.
articles.content: Should armed conflict break out between Ukraine and oil-producing Russia, which also supplies oil to Europe, the price of crude oil and its refined products such as petrol will undoubtedly rise, expe… [+5545 chars]

articles.author: Camille Gijs
articles.title: Top French minister: Europe shouldn’t be ‘dragged’ into following US on Nord Stream 2 - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: Bruno Le Maire says ‘the Americans will not have to bear the same consequences of a conflict in Ukraine as the Europeans, especially in terms of energy prices.’
articles.content: French Economy Minister Bruno Le Maire said Tuesday that Europe should not be "dragged" into following the U.S. position on the controversial Nord Stream 2 pipeline, after U.S. President Joe Biden vo… [+2002 chars]
